ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I felt like I left the course with a deep understanding of the natural experiment methodology, but more importantly with a broader understanding of the nature of causal research in general. By the end of the course, I began to be able to discern between well-executed studies that present convincing theories and evidence and weaker studies. I feel like I could now come up with experimental designs on my own and evaluate them. I also appreciated the practical focus of the course. The GIS assignment and the text analysis tutorials were hugely helpful.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really liked the way the syllabus was divided up. Reading several different approaches to one subject was a really effective way to teach us how to evaluate research designs. It also made it so you could see the evolution of the field and understand the current important questions. I also appreciated the practical focus of the course. The GIS assignment and the text analysis tutorials were hugely helpful.

I really liked this course but I would have liked to have learned about qualitative methods in more detail, especially how to incorporate qualitative data into a quantitative project. We did cover this in terms of text analysis, and it would have been great to have hands on experience with other examples.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would definitely recommend this course. One helpful aspect was that it gave such a broad overview of different subjects and research questions. While focusing on a particular set of tools, we were able to see how they would apply to questions from all over the field. This left me feeling like I had a real sense of what the important questions are in the field, something that usually takes years to start to understand. I would also recommend it because it helped me think of several projects I want to undertake on my own and made me believe I could accomplish them.
